title.narrative: Somalia: Targeted country assistance
Somalie (la): Aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Somalie (la), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Somalie (la) ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Somalia through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Somalia, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Evidence based SBCC to inform maternal and new-born child health and Urban Immunization Strategies are developed

target.value: C4D Specialist P3 - TA to support the development and implementation of evidence based interventions to ensure demand and uptake of immunization are adequetely and timely supported in FMS, Puntland and Somaliland.

title.narrative: HCD trainings implemented in FMS, Puntland and Somaliland

target.value: Conduct human centered training at 3 locations in FMS, Somaliland and Puntland to support development and implementation of Urban Immunization Strategy.

title.narrative:
Urban demand creation strategy developed informed by the outcome of the human-centered research conducted in Mogadishu.
SMS reminder system in place at the community level contributing to the reduction of Penta1/Penta3 drop-out rate

target.value: Recruitment of C4D Specialist P3 - TA to gather and synthesise data for the generation of additional social evidence to inform the development of priority demand creation interventions e.g. mobile platforms / SMS reminders) to increase coverage for new HSS support. To also support the development of a communication plan for VPD emergencies.

Recruitment of C4D Specialist P3 - TA to gather and synthesise data for the generation of additional social evidence to inform the development of priority demand creation interventions e.g. mobile platforms / SMS reminders) to increase coverage for new HSS support. To also support the development of a communication plan for VPD emergencies.

title.narrative: Penta 1/Penta 3 drop-out rate is decreased from 8% to 4%.

target.value: Support the implementation of the social mobilisation activities which align with the micro-plans in the 25 supported districts. Ensure C4D microplanning/mapping of communities as well as local and religious influencers and development of district communication plans to maximise the impact of the planned C4D activities including for cross-border areas.

Ensure C4D microplanning/mapping of communities as well as local and religious influencers and development of district communication plans to maximise the impact of the planned C4D activities including for cross-border areas.

title.narrative: C4D trainings implemented in 43 priority districts

target.value: Support training of Social Mobilization Coordinators (SOMNET) in focused districts in FMS, Somaliland & Puntland on C4D methods including social and behavioural change interventions, community engagement, monitoring and supervision, data collection and use.

title.narrative: Lessons learnt are used to inform the 2021 demand creation strategies of the Ministry of Health

target.value: Support training of health care providers in focused districts in FMS, Somaliland & Puntland on C4D methods to reinforce the capacity of collecting and using social data to design and implement effective C4D interventions including social mobilization and IPC.

Support training of health care providers in focused districts in FMS, Somaliland & Puntland on C4D methods to reinforce the capacity of collecting and using social data to design and implement effective C4D interventions including social mobilization and IPC.

title.narrative: Maternal and new-born child health strategy for demand creation, including routine immunisation utilised in 100% of districts

target.value: Conduct an operational research to understand social norms and behaviours affecting access to routine immunisation. This will assess the social norms and behaviours of different target groups, that influence access to routine immunisation and factors contributing to the low utilisation of services.

MCV2 and Td vaccines are fully introduced in all districts in the FMS and immunization services are integrated with Nutrition and WASH activities.

Support the coordination of immunization activities. Support the introduction of MCV2 and the switch from TT to Td

title.narrative: UNICEF : Data

1.HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2.This will help to Identify, capture, synthesize, and share lessons learned for knowledge development and to build the capacity of stakeholders. 2. Support and lead the DHIS2 Indicator review and the officer will install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2 3. Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs. 4. Conduct regular programme field visits and share information with partners and stakeholders to assess progress and provide technical support progress and provide technical support

target.value: 1. HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2.This will help to Identify, capture, synthesize, and share lessons learned for knowledge development and to build the capacity of stakeholders. 2. Re-train health workers and partners on the correct use of revised HMIS data collection and monitoring tools, data analysis, interpretation, and use, employing DHIS2 and Provide training on the use of revised manual stock management tools, forecasting, wastage, and calculations 3. Conduct regular programme field visits and surveys and share information with partners and stakeholders to assess progress and provide technical support and/or refer to relevant officials for resolution. Report on critical issues, bottlenecks, and potential problems for timely action to achieve results. 4. Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs. 5. Apply innovative approaches and promote good practices to support the implementation and delivery of concrete and sustainable programme results. Assist with oversight of research and ensure results are available for use in knowledge products. 6. Support and lead the DHIS2 Indicator review and the officer will install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2

title.narrative: 1.Re-train health workers and partners on the correct use of revised HMIS data collection and monitoring tools, data analysis, interpretation, and use, employing DHIS2 and Provide training on the use of revised manual stock management tools, forecasting, wastage, and calculations 2.Functional system for monitoring vaccine stock-out and wastage rates customized in DHIS2 to provide Situation analysis on vaccine stock-outs & wastages conducted, Monthly reporting of EPI data from hard-to-reach facilities through DHIS2, 3.Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs.

target.value: 1. HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2.This will help to Identify, capture, synthesize, and share lessons learned for knowledge development and to build the capacity of stakeholders. 2. Re-train health workers and partners on the correct use of revised HMIS data collection and monitoring tools, data analysis, interpretation, and use, employing DHIS2 and Provide training on the use of revised manual stock management tools, forecasting, wastage, and calculations 3. Conduct regular programme field visits and surveys and share information with partners and stakeholders to assess progress and provide technical support and/or refer to relevant officials for resolution. Report on critical issues, bottlenecks, and potential problems for timely action to achieve results. 4. Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs. 5. Apply innovative approaches and promote good practices to support the implementation and delivery of concrete and sustainable programme results. Assist with oversight of research and ensure results are available for use in knowledge products. 6. Support and lead the DHIS2 Indicator review and the officer will install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery

29 prirority districts implementing integrated EPI/Nutrition services in fixed, outreach and mobile strategies and zero-dose as well as under-vaccinated children reached in the priority districts and urban areas. EPI recovery plan is implemented (if financed).

target.value: Provide technical assistance in the implementation of the urban immunization strategy in 2 priority districts and support the implementation of the integrated EPI/Nutrition programme in 29 priority districts through MoH and NGO/CSOs. Emphasis will be reaching zero dose and missed children identified in the 2 urban areas and also identifying and reaching missed children living in rural and remote communities. Also to support the implementation and monitoring of on-going HSS2 programme in 14 districts across Somalia. Also to support the MoH and UNICEF Field Offices in scaling-up defaulter tracing mechanisms to reduce drop-outs. Also work closely with MoH and WHO to develop an EPI recovery plan to reach children missed and under-vaccinated children in most-affected districts following the impact/effect of COVID-19.

title.narrative: 100% of the priority districts are implementing integrated EPI/Nutrition outreaches. nOPV2 is introduced for polio outbreak management in the FMS

target.value: HSS/NOB staff in SCZ to support identification and reaching missed & zero dose children living in 19 priority districts of the FMS through outreach and mobile strategies. The staff will support the priority districts in developing integrated EPI micro-plans (including cold chain & demand generation) and that community leaders are closely invlolved in the development of these micro-plans. To coordinate and monthly monitoring of activities implemented by NGOs/CSOs providing integrated EPI and nutrition services in the priority districts of the FMS. This will ensure that marginalised communities are reached with critical life-saving PHC interventions. To also support the MoH in the introduction of new vaccines; MCV2, nOPV2 and fIPV.

title.narrative: 19 Priority districts develop micro-plans and integrated EPI/Nutrition outreaches & mobile services are provided by NGO/CSO partners

target.value: HSS/NOB staff in SCZ to support identification and reaching missed & zero dose children living in 19 priority districts of the FMS through outreach and mobile strategies. The staff will support the priority districts in developing integrated EPI micro-plans (including cold chain & demand generation) and that community leaders are closely invlolved in the development of these micro-plans. To coordinate and monthly monitoring of activities implemented by NGOs/CSOs providing integrated EPI and nutrition services in the priority districts of the FMS. This will ensure that marginalised communities are reached with critical life-saving PHC interventions. To also support the MoH in the introduction of new vaccines; MCV2, nOPV2 and fIPV.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Management - LMC
Urban immunization stretagy implemented in Mogadishu, 33 health fcailities providing RI services through fixed and outreach sessions

target.value: P4 and 2 NOB to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations, also support MoH in implementation of urban immunization stretagy in Mogadishu

P4 and 2 NOB to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations, also support MoH in implementation of urban immunization stretagy in Mogadishu

title.narrative: WHO
Comprehensive plan developed by engaging all stakeholders.

target.value: Development of new cMYP for next cycle.

title.narrative: 67 health facilities ( supported under HSS additional funds) microplans developed as per RED approach

target.value: P4 and 2 NOB to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations, also support MoH in implementation of urban immunization stretagy in Mogadishu

title.narrative: Potential Private health service providers identified.

target.value: Using the findings of the 'Assessing the capacity of the private health system in Somalia' done by Oxford Policy Management (OPM) contracted by GF/UNICEF, potential private sector health service providers will be identified to find out right engagement strategy for immunization service delivery.

title.narrative: WHO : Data
Data Improvement Plan (DIP) implemented

target.value: To Support at national level based in Mogadishu, this position will support MOH in data analysis and management. He will also provide monthly immunization analysis to all states to provide support for timely actions to understand where we are missing children. he will also ensure rggular screening and cleaning of data.

title.narrative: Data desk review or triangulation analysis performed (coverage, surveillance, operational, others)

target.value: To Support at national level based in Mogadishu, this position will support MOH in data analysis and management. He will also provide monthly immunization analysis to all states to provide support for timely actions to understand where we are missing children. he will also ensure rggular screening and cleaning of data.

title.narrative: Data improvement field activity implemented (review, validation, monitoring, harmonisation, mentorship, workshop, others)

target.value: To provide support to MOH ( Galmadug and Hargisa) in strengthening integrated surveillance system including lab component, especially measles case based surveillance. Support MOH in data analysis of routine immunization, support MoH in introduction of electronic registration, recording and reporting tool for COVID 19 vaccination

title.narrative: New specific VPD surveillance system implemented or integrated

target.value: To provide support to MOH ( Galmadug and Hargisa) in strengthening integrated surveillance system including lab component, especially measles case based surveillance. Support MOH in data analysis of routine immunization, support MoH in introduction of electronic registration, recording and reporting tool for COVID 19 vaccination

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
Systems in place to track fund utilisation at all levels and corrective measures undertaken

target.value: To support FMoH & all state ministeries in implementation of DQIP, COVID 19 vaccination rollout and in introduction of new vaccine including IPV2, MCV2 and fIPV .Support PL MoH in improving routine immunization and Mass campaigns implementation.

title.narrative: Annual workplan and budgets include interventions to reach zero dose children

target.value: To support FMoH & all state ministeries in implementation of DQIP, COVID 19 vaccination rollout and in introduction of new vaccine including IPV2, MCV2 and fIPV .Support PL MoH in improving routine immunization and Mass campaigns implementation.
To support MOH for urban immunization implementation in Mogadishu. Support Banadir administration in introduction of MCV2, IPV2, fIPV, COVID 19 vaccination

title.narrative: EPI reviews and Joint Appraisals are well managed ensuring availability of relevant data to track progress

target.value: To support MOH for urban immunization implementation in Mogadishu. Support Banadir administration in introduction of MCV2, IPV2, fIPV, COVID 19 vaccination
